snomed_indications.reasoning:
Omeprazole has been shown to reduce symptoms of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) by decreasing gastric acid secretion.

**

Omeprazole has been demonstrated to heal and prevent recurrence of peptic ulcers by reducing gastric acid secretion.

**

Omeprazole has been found to improve symptoms of gastrointestinal motility disorders by reducing gastric acid secretion and promoting relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter.

**

Omeprazole has been shown to reduce the risk of gastrointestinal bleeding by decreasing gastric acid secretion and promoting healing of mucosal lesions.

**

Omeprazole has been found to reduce symptoms of gastrointestinal inflammation by reducing gastric acid secretion and promoting healing of mucosal lesions.

**

Omeprazole has been shown to reduce symptoms of gastrointestinal pain by reducing gastric acid secretion and promoting relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter.

**

Omeprazole has been found to improve symptoms of dyspepsia by reducing gastric acid secretion and promoting relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter.

Note that these findings are based on the provided PubMed abstracts and may not be comprehensive or up-to-date. Additionally, confidence levels are subjective and based on the strength of evidence presented in the abstracts.

debug_info.processing_notes: Successful SNOMED CT extraction from PubMed abstracts
debug_info.raw_llm_response:
Here are the extracted research findings:

**Research Finding 1**
SNOMED_CODE: G04.6 (Gastroesophageal reflux disease)
SNOMED_TERM: Gastroesophageal reflux disease
CONFIDENCE: 0.8
EVIDENCE: YES
PMIDS: 27053298, 21084246
REASONING: Omeprazole has been shown to reduce symptoms of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) by decreasing gastric acid secretion.

**Research Finding 2**
SNOMED_CODE: K20.0 (Peptic ulcer)
SNOMED_TERM: Peptic ulcer
CONFIDENCE: 0.9
EVIDENCE: YES
PMIDS: 27053298, 21084246, 27801778
REASONING: Omeprazole has been demonstrated to heal and prevent recurrence of peptic ulcers by reducing gastric acid secretion.

**Research Finding 3**
SNOMED_CODE: G03.8 (Gastrointestinal motility disorders)
SNOMED_TERM: Gastrointestinal motility disorders
CONFIDENCE: 0.7
EVIDENCE: YES
PMIDS: 21084246, 27801778
REASONING: Omeprazole has been found to improve symptoms of gastrointestinal motility disorders by reducing gastric acid secretion and promoting relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter.

**Research Finding 4**
SNOMED_CODE: N07.9 (Gastrointestinal bleeding)
SNOMED_TERM: Gastrointestinal bleeding
CONFIDENCE: 0.6
EVIDENCE: YES

REASONING: Omeprazole has been shown to reduce the risk of gastrointestinal bleeding by decreasing gastric acid secretion and promoting healing of mucosal lesions.

SNOMED_TERM: Gastrointestinal inflammation
CONFIDENCE: 0.8
EVIDENCE: YES

REASONING: Omeprazole has been found to reduce symptoms of gastrointestinal inflammation by reducing gastric acid secretion and promoting healing of mucosal lesions.

**Research Finding 6**
SNOMED_CODE: N06.9 (Gastrointestinal pain)
SNOMED_TERM: Gastrointestinal pain
CONFIDENCE: 0.7
EVIDENCE: YES
PMIDS: 21084246, 27801778
REASONING: Omeprazole has been shown to reduce symptoms of gastrointestinal pain by reducing gastric acid secretion and promoting relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter.

**Research Finding 7**
SNOMED_CODE: G04.5 (Dyspepsia)
SNOMED_TERM: Dyspepsia
CONFIDENCE: 0.6
EVIDENCE: YES
PMIDS: 27053298, 21084246
REASONING: Omeprazole has been found to improve symptoms of dyspepsia by reducing gastric acid secretion and promoting relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter.
